title: Rolling Stones - Unsurpassed Masters Volumes 1-7 FLAC
description:
The Rolling Stones - 1963-1964 - Unsurpassed Masters Volumes 1-7 Remastered (FLAC)


I am really, really glad I was able to recover this set from a bad hard drive. It was researched and compiled by a person known as JWB. He undertook a mammoth project, locating the best-available sources for all of this material, and mastering it, and getting it out there. I have to say that this is, hands down, the most impressive fan-created collection I have ever heard. It should be held up as an example of what an exhaustive retrospective or anthology should be like. 99% of the recordings are in stunning quality. You may never have heard some of these recordings in this kind of quality. All credit and thanks must go to JWB, who truly went above and beyond on this one.

Now, under inspection, it was discovered that each of the tracks but one ran at a slightly different pitch. So they were all tuned to a digital keyboard. Phase and level correction was done. Clipping was undone. No further modifications were made to the recordings. To the best of my knowledge, these are the finest renditions of these tapes that you may ever hear, and I have many Stones boots of the same material. This puts many of them to shame. You will not be disappointed after hearing this disc.



Remastered Edition

Tracks 1-2 recorded December 1969 at Muscle Shoals, Alabama
Track 3 recorded October 1969 at Elektra Studios, Hollywood
Tracks 4-16 recorded March-October 1970 ("Sticky Fingers" Sessions)

Tracks 18-19 recorded June-November 1971 ("Exile On Main Street" Sessions)
Track 20 recorded March 28, 1972 at Sunset Sound, Los Angeles

All tracks STEREO except 4, 13, 19 which are MONO.

The Rolling Stones - 1972-1976 - Unsurpassed Masters Vol. 5
(Studio FLAC)

Lineage: 
Various Silver and Vinyl bootlegs -> WAV (Remastered) -> FLAC (Level 8)

02 Waiting On A Friend (Alternate Mix)

16 Munich Reggae (Instrumental Outtake)
17 Start Me Up (Demo)

Tracks 1-4 recorded November-December 1972 ("Goats Head Soup" Sessions)
Tracks 5-9 recorded January-May 1974 ("It's Only Rock & Roll" Sessions)
Tracks 10-17 recorded December 1974-March 1975 ("Black & Blue" Sessions)

All tracks STEREO except 2, 17 which are MONO.

There was no compression or hiss reduction done during the remastering process. Everything has been left as pure as possible. Sometimes, unwanted processing and sonic imperfections are inherent in the source material used.
